metadata.synopsis: Affable but clueless Bronx, N.Y., native Frankie (Nick Scotti) is an aspiring actor who moves to Manhattan after discovering his fiancée is sleeping with his brother (Anthony DeSando). Not understanding that the want-ad shorthand "GWM seeks same" means Gay White Male -- he thinks it's Guy With Money -- Frankie moves in with actor Warren (Anthony Barrile). When Warren has to drop out of a role, Frankie is unsure whether he's ready to take over the part, which includes a man-to-man kiss.

reviews: This minor indie farce plays gay and Italian-American stereotypical characters, resulting in a pleasant feel-good movie but no more.
Disappointing indie comedy. One joke that's not even that funny the first time.

Kiss Me, Guido is a movie with a lot of funny one-liners, but no place to go with them. Like a 30-minute sitcom, it acts like you already know all the characters and are just happy to have fresh dialogue.
